text: Clarence Henry Reid (February 14, 1939 - January 17, 2016), better known by the stage name Blowfly, was an American musician, singer, comedian, rapper and producer. He released over 25 parody albums as "Blowfly" and another three albums as "Clarence Reid". He also wrote ten songs for Gwen McCrae. Blowfly was born in Cochran, Georgia. His daughter, Tracy Reid, was a professional basketball player. Blowfly died from liver cancer on January 17, 2016 in Florida, aged 76. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1939 births Category:2016 deaths Category:African-American comedians Category:African- American singers Category:American funk musicians Category:American hip hop musicians Category:American punk musicians Category:American R&B; singers Category:American soul singers Category:Rappers from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:American record producers Category:American funk singers Category:American rock singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American soul musicians Category:Cancer deaths in Florida Category:Comedians from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:Singers from Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Blowfly (musician)
